title: Two persons killed in shooting at Mount Lavinia
byline: Two persons have been killed after an unidentified gunman opened fire at them at the Watarappala Road in Mount Lavinia, police said.

title: Draft Bill to call for fresh nominations for LG polls gazetted
byline: The Draft Bill for the amendment of the Local Authorities Elections Act to enable the cancellation of the nominations submitted for the 2023 polls and to call for fresh nominations has been gazetted.

title: Showers expected in parts of the country
byline: The Meteorology Department says a few showers will occur in Northern, North-central, Eastern and Uva provinces.

title: Judge denies Trump bid to delay sentencing in hush money case
byline: A New York judge will not delay this Friday’s sentencing of President-elect Donald Trump in his felony hush money case.

title: Central Bank Governor discusses future of vehicle imports in Sri Lanka
byline: The Governor of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL), Dr. Nandalal Weerasinghe shared his perspective on the future of vehicle imports, during the ‘Derana 360°’ programme last night (6).

title: Sri Lankans hold 65 million deposit accounts: Central Bank Governor reveals
byline: The Governor of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL), Dr. Nandalal Weerasinghe revealed statistics of the nation’s deposit accounts during his appearance on Ada Derana’s current affairs programme “360°” yesterday (06).

title: Parliament convenes for first session of 2025
byline: The Parliament of Sri Lanka is set to convene for its first session of the new year today (07) at 9:30 a.m., under the patronage of Speaker Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne.

title: HMPV rarely fatal, previously detected in Sri Lanka: Health officials
byline: The Medical Research Institute (MRI) has confirmed that the Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV), currently spreading in China, is a disease which has already been identified in a few instances in Sri Lanka.

title: Per capita debt in Sri Lanka hits Rs. 1.3 million
byline: The total public debt outstanding as of December 31, 2023, has surpassed Rs. 29,150 billion, according to the government’s financial statement.

title: Foreign reserves robust, debt payments manageable - CBSL Governor
byline: The Governor of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka, Dr. Nandalal Weerasinghe assured that Sri Lanka’s foreign reserves remain robust.

title: Four international flights to BIA diverted to Mattala and India
byline: Four international flights scheduled to land at Bandaranaike International Airport in Katunayake in the early hours of January 07 were diverted due to dense fog that significantly reduced visibility.

title: Harris certifies Trump’s US election victory
byline: Four years to the day after a mob of Donald Trump’s supporters violently besieged the US Capitol, Congress formally certified the incoming president’s re-election in a special session.

title: Finance Ministry orders auction of state-owned V8 luxury vehicles
byline: The Secretary to the Ministry of Finance, Mahinda Siriwardena, has directed all state institutions to auction the high-capacity V8 luxury vehicles under their purview and submit revenue reports by March 01.

title: WHO recognizes Sri Lanka’s mental health reforms
byline: The World Health Organization (WHO) has recognized Sri Lanka’s focus on expanding community-based networks and de-institutionalization as a significant step toward improving mental health services.

title: Compensation for patients affected by eye surgery complications at N’Eliya Hospital
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has approved granting compensation to 17 patients who had developed complications after undergoing cataract surgery at the Nuwara Eliya District Hospital.

title: Strong earthquake kills at least 53 people in western China
byline: A strong earthquake killed at least 53 people in Tibet on Tuesday and left many others trapped as dozens of aftershocks shook the region of western China and across the border in Nepal.

title: Govt. to review ‘Nearest School is the Best School’ program
byline: The Prime Minister and the Minister of Education Dr. Harini Amarasuriya says that a review will be conducted on the partially completed schools under the “Nearest School is the Best School” (NSBS) flagship programme launched in 2016.

title: Nvidia boss unveils next-generation gaming chips
byline: The boss of US computer chip giant Nvidia has unveiled the firm’s next-generation of gaming chips, known as the RTX 50-series.

title: Spider-Man stars Zendaya and Tom Holland engaged
byline: Spider-Man co-stars Tom Holland and Zendaya are engaged.

title: ‘Sabaragamuwa Maha Saman Devalaya’ reopens
byline: Measures have been taken to reopen the ‘Sabaragamuwa Maha Saman Devalaya’ in response to requests made by the Maha Sangha and local residents.

title: EC initiates legal action against 12 presidential candidates
byline: The Election Commission has directed the District Election Offices to finalize the files of the candidates who failed to submit their income and expenditure reports related to the 2024 General Election and promptly forward them to the police for legal action.

title: President appoints 4 new Ambassadors and High Commissioner
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has appointed a High Commissioner and four Ambassadors to serve in Sri Lanka’s diplomatic service.

title: Easter Sunday attacks: Public Security Minister reveals details on arrested suspects
byline: Minister of Public Security Ananda Wijepala revealed today (07) that a total of 747 suspects have been arrested in connection with the 2019 Easter Sunday terror attacks, following extensive investigations by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) and the Terrorism Investigation Division (TID).

title: Eye surgery complications at N’Eliya Hospital: Compensation up to Rs. 1M for patients
byline: Cabinet Spokesman, Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa revealed the method of granting compensation to 17 patients who had developed complications after undergoing cataract surgery at the Nuwara Eliya District Hospital.

title: Japan pledges continuous financial and technical assistance to Sri Lanka
byline: The Japan International Cooperation Agency (JICA) will continue its financial and technical assistance to Sri Lanka without interruption, says the Senior Vice President of JICA, HARA Shohei.

title: New District Secretary appointed for Trincomalee
byline: The Additional Director General of the Department of Fisheries and Aquatic Resources, W.G.M. Hemantha Kumara has been appointed to the post of District Secretary of Trincomalee.

title: Special announcement on stationery allowance for school children
byline: The government has decided to provide the school stationery allowance granted for the children of “Aswesuma” beneficiaries to all children in 6,576 schools with less than 300 students who are from families that are not beneficiaries of the welfare scheme...

title: Sri Lanka to export poultry to China
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has greenlighted the signing of a protocol for the export of poultry products from Sri Lanka to China.

title: President Dissanayake to visit China next week
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake is scheduled to embark on an official visit to China from January 14 to January 17, 2025.

title: TRCSL approves tariff plans for ‘Starlink’
byline: The Telecommunications Regulatory Commission of Sri Lanka (TRCSL) has approved the tariff plans for ‘Starlink’ satellite broadband services to be implemented through ‘Starlink’ Lanka (Private) Ltd.

title: TRCSL approves tariff plans for ‘Starlink’
byline: The Telecommunications Regulatory Commission of Sri Lanka (TRCSL) has approved the tariff plans for ‘Starlink’ satellite broadband services to be implemented through ‘Starlink’ Lanka (Private) Ltd.

title: Sri Lanka agrees to further support “One China Policy”
byline: Sri Lanka’s Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval for the continuation of supporting the “One China Policy”.

title: Stray dog first to cross border as Romania, Bulgaria join Schengen Zone
byline: When Bulgaria and Romania finally joined the Schengen Area, marking the end of border checks, a historic moment unfolded at the border. Officials gathered to celebrate the milestone, commemorating the first time crossings could happen freely between the two nations.

title: 90% of compensation for 2024 ‘Yala’ season released
byline: The Agricultural and Agrarian Insurance Board says that around 90% of the compensation payments for the crop damage in the 2024 ‘Yala’ season have been disbursed.

title: Indian PM Modi to visit Sri Lanka in 2025
byline: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will visit Sri Lanka within this year, the Indian High Commission in Colombo announced on Tuesday (07).

title: President discusses challenges surrounding vehicle imports with officials
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has held an extensive discussion with officials from the Ministry of Finance today (07) at the Presidential Secretariat focusing on issues related to vehicle imports, withholding tax, and the digitalization of VAT collection.

title: Govt to repatriate Sri Lankans illegally staying in South Korea
byline: The Chairman of the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE), Koshala Wickremasinghe emphasized that immediate actions will be taken to repatriate Sri Lankan nationals who are illegally staying in South Korea after their visas expired.

title: More details emerge about Mount Lavinia shooting that killed 2
byline: Two individuals were killed in a shooting incident early this morning (07) on Watarappala Road, Mount Lavinia, which had been carried out by two unidentified gunmen.

title: Committee on Public Finance meets for first time
byline: The Committee on Public Finance met for the first time yesterday (06) under the Chairmanship of its Chair, Member of Parliament Dr. Harsha de Silva.
